intro: Hubertia neoheimii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and broad, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, which bloom during the warm season. It is well adapted to dry environments, storing water in its thick stems and leaves. Hubertia neoheimii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its resilience and striking floral display.
